title: Acceptable Use Policy (AUP)
introduction: This Acceptable Use Policy ("AUP") defines permissible and prohibited uses of Expanse services. By using our services, you agree to comply with this AUP in addition to the Terms of Service (ToS), Privacy Policy, and Service Level Agreement (SLA).

sections.title: General Principles
sections.content: The Customer must use Expanse services legally, ethically, responsibly, and without harming Expanse infrastructure, customers, or upstream providers. You are responsible for all activity originating from your services.

sections.title: Prohibited Content & Activities
sections.content: The following are strictly prohibited on all Expanse services:

sections.title: 2.1 Illegal Content
list: Anything illegal under UK law or the customer’s jurisdiction

sections.title: 2.2 Malicious Activity
list: Any malicious activity triggers immediate termination

sections.title: 2.3 Network Abuse
list: Flooding, packet crafting, amplification, or stress-testing tools
Port scanning, OS fingerprinting, or brute force attempts
Using Expanse Minecraft proxies to reach external servers
IP spoofing, ARP spoofing, MITM attempts

sections.title: 2.4 Spam & Email Misuse
sections.content: SMTP abuse results in a 24-hour window to respond, then suspension.
list: Running mailers, spam tools, or email bombers

sections.title: 2.5 Resource Abuse
list: Excessively consuming CPU, RAM, or disk I/O to degrade node performance
Causing abnormal load (e.g., chunk pregeneration) without permission
Running infinite loops or faulty scripts causing crashes
sections.content: Expanse may throttle, cap, or limit usage to maintain stability.

sections.title: 2.6 High-Risk Workloads
sections.content: These workloads are banned across all services:
list: Any workload generating upstream provider complaints

sections.title: 3.1 Minecraft Hosting
list: No malicious plugins, illegal modpacks, or compromised server jars
No using our MC proxy to connect to external servers
Heavy tasks (pregeneration, world expansion) must be approved
No automated bot swarms or high-risk modpacks

sections.title: 3.3 VPS & Dedicated Servers
list: Proxy/VPN services used for public traffic
Traffic tunneling used for attacks or evasion
Running anything that intentionally saturates the network
sections.content: Private VPNs/proxies are allowed only if not used for abuse.

sections.title: Security Requirements
list: Keep software and plugins up to date
Ensure web apps are not vulnerable (SQLi, RCE, LFI, etc.)
sections.content: Failure to secure services results in customer liability.

sections.title: Abuse Handling
list: Verified abuse may result in immediate suspension
You must respond to abuse tickets within 24 hours
Continued abuse or no response leads to termination
Illegal activity will be reported to law enforcement
Null-routing may be applied to protect infrastructure

sections.title: Fair Use Guidelines
list: Services must not degrade performance for other customers
Unlimited features are subject to fair use
Expanse may migrate, throttle, or isolate noisy workloads
